definition: to halt/to stay/to be stationed (of troops, diplomats etc)
to prick/to run or stick (a needle etc) into/jug (a classifier for liquids such as beer)
to tie/to bind/classifier for flowers, banknotes etc: bundle/Taiwan pr. [zha2]

sentences.english: The looting appeared to be dissipating as police vans were stationed at damage sites.
sentences.chinese: 抢劫行动看起来被驻扎在受损地点的警车驱散。

sentences.english: Think not in terms not of attacking, but of moving troops from place to place and stationing them here or there.
sentences.chinese: 和袭击关系不大，但和迁移部队，流动驻扎有关。

sentences.english: An idol is anything that takes the place of God in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 偶像取代了上帝驻扎进在我心里。

sentences.english: " Pape's approach ignores the context in which deployment and stationing of U.S. forces occurs.
sentences.chinese: 佩普的做法忽略了美军部署和驻扎阿富汗的原因。

sentences.english: In former times the British army kept lots of soldiers at Fort William in Scotland.
sentences.chinese: 从前英国军队在苏格兰的威廉堡驻扎了很多士兵。

sentences.english: The soldiers were quartered in the town .
A mounted sentinel stationed in advance of an outpost.
sentences.chinese: 骑哨先于前哨基地驻扎的骑马的。

sentences.english: German troops are based in neighbouring Kunduz province, and have oversight of Takhar.
sentences.chinese: 照管塔哈尔省的德军军队驻扎在邻近的昆都士地区。

sentences.english: It was larger and had a number of Roman soldiers living in it too.
sentences.chinese: 迦百农是一个较大的城巿，不少罗马士兵驻扎其中。

sentences.english: His army is stationed near the border line.
sentences.chinese: 他所在的部队就驻扎在边防线附近。

sentences.english: Thee odd choice of lodging, Langdon explained, had been anything but random.
sentences.chinese: 兰登解释道，武士团选择这样奇怪的驻扎地绝非偶然。

sentences.english: They shelled and blockaded Visoko, where Canadians (peacekeepers) were posted.
sentences.chinese: 他们炮轰并封锁加拿大维和部队驻扎的维索科镇。

sentences.english: Soldiers and armed police in Beijing also joined the army of sweepers.
sentences.chinese: 驻扎在北京的解放军和武警战士也加入了扫雪大军。

sentences.english: Prey stationed herself in front of a large TV screen to watch the flight.
sentences.chinese: 食饵驻扎在一个大的电视屏幕前观看自己的飞行。

sentences.english: Previously, most U.S. troops had been sequestered in five huge military bases.
sentences.chinese: 之前，大多数美国军队驻扎在五个巨型军事基地。

sentences.english: These squadrons would be trained and prepared in their own countries, but would move around in rotation from one country to another.
sentences.chinese: 这些中队将由本国训练和筹备，但在各国轮流驻扎。

definition: to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
stronghold/defended military base/base for operations/strategic point/foothold/(market) presence
to set up camp/Taiwan pr. [an1 ying2 zha2 zhai4]
to camp/to pitch camp/stationed/quartered/Taiwan pr. [zha2 ying2]
to garrison/to stand guard/on garrison duty
